She had received death threats in the past for her work, and her killing has sparked outrage and grief across the country.

Mangu Ram, an 82-year-old Hindu traditional healer, fled to Kashmir as a refugee in 1947. He and thousands of other West Pakistan Refugees (WPRs) have been denied citizenship rights, including the right to own property or vote in state elections, for 70 years. This has resulted in three generations of WPRs living in abject poverty. The reluctance of successive state governments to grant full rights to the WPRs stems from fears of upsetting the demographic balance in India's only Muslim-majority state. However, with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) winning a share of power in Kashmir, there is hope that the WPRs' status will be normalized. The BJP is expected to champion the refugees' cause, but if their hopes are dashed again, the community is ready to take matters into their own hands.

Yoshinori Muto, a forward for FC Tokyo, is considering a move to Chelsea this summer. Chelsea has made an offer for the 22-year-old, but Muto wants to join a club where he can play regularly and develop his skills. Chelsea is interested in Muto because of his potential and because of their sponsorship deal with Yokohama Rubber, a Japanese tire manufacturer. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho has admitted that commercial interests play a part in the club's transfer policy.

England's rugby team should be allowed to select their best players, regardless of where they play. Australia has changed their policy to allow players who play overseas to be selected for their national team. This is a positive change that England should follow. England's coach should be able to pick the best players, even if they play for clubs in other countries. This is because the best players will help England win the World Cup, which is the ultimate goal.

Open Garden has developed a device called Greenstone that acts as a beacon to strengthen wireless mesh networks. Greenstone is designed to help messages travel further in these networks, which are used by the Firechat app to allow communication without internet or mobile signal. Firechat, which has been downloaded over 5 million times, uses Apple's Multipeer Connectivity Framework (MCF) to create a localized network where phones act as nodes and pass data between each other. Greenstone can extend the range of these networks beyond the typical 200 feet, enabling communication in larger areas like neighborhoods, hospitals, or events with large crowds.

Lillian Bustle, a burlesque performer, is working to change the negative connotations associated with the word "fat" by embracing it as a positive and honest descriptor of her own body. She argues that the word "fat" should not be synonymous with "ugly" and that beauty comes in all shapes and sizes. Bustle believes that exposure to body diversity can lead to greater tolerance and acceptance of different body types. She uses her burlesque performances to showcase a "fat" body in a positive and glamorous way, challenging societal norms about what is considered desirable. Bustle's TED Talk has received overwhelmingly positive feedback, with many viewers expressing gratitude and sharing personal stories about how it has impacted their own body image.

Theo Walcott, an Arsenal winger, has been sitting on the bench for most of the season. He was recently photographed with other Arsenal players for a photoshoot with Lanvin, the club's official tailor since 2013. Walcott has been named on the substitutes' bench for 17 of Arsenal's 33 Premier League games this season. He came on for the last six minutes of Arsenal's 0-0 draw with Chelsea on Sunday. Walcott is hoping to make his first start since March 14th when Arsenal faces Hull on Monday.

Legendary make-up effects artist Rick Baker is auctioning off over 400 props and puppets from his 30-year career, including items from films like *Men in Black*, *Batman Forever*, and *How the Grinch Stole Christmas*. The auction will take place on May 29th at the Hilton Universal City in Los Angeles, California, and on Propstore.com. The collection is estimated to be worth $746,100, with some individual items expected to fetch more than $40,000.

Carwyn Scott-Howell, a seven-year-old boy from Wales, died while skiing with his family in the French Alps. He became separated from his mother and entered dense woodland, where he fell over a 164-foot drop. His body was found by police who followed his footprints in the snow. Carwyn was described as a daring, outgoing, and determined young boy who loved skiing and snowboarding. His family said they were enjoying a happy ski holiday in Flaine, France, before the tragedy occurred.

Laura Scurr, a 15-year-old from Whitley Bay, developed anorexia after being bullied for her weight and feeling pressured to be a size zero. She would hide food and eat only one piece of fruit a day, leading to a dramatic weight loss and a collapse at home. After a week on a heart monitor, Laura began working with eating disorder teams and child and adolescent mental health services to recover. Today, she has a better body image and has made it to the semi-final of Miss Teen GB, a competition that promotes positive and confidence-building experiences for young girls, away from size zero stereotypes.

Liverpool supporters chanted at Raheem Sterling, urging him to stay at the club. Sterling, along with other Liverpool players, unveiled the new home kit, designed by New Balance, the club's new kit supplier. The new kit features all white branding and a new collar style. Sterling recently rejected a Â£100,000-a-week contract offer from Liverpool, but the club is adamant that he will stay.

A team of researchers at the University of Manchester has created the largest single high-definition map of dark matter, covering 0.4% of the sky. The map was created using data from the Dark Energy Camera, a 570-megapixel imaging device that is the primary instrument for the Dark Energy Survey (DES). The DES is a five-year project that aims to map 12.5% of the sky, creating a 3D map of dark matter and dark energy. The map shows clumps of dark matter, with red indicating more dark matter and blue indicating less. The researchers used gravitational lensing to study the distortion of light around distant galaxies caused by the gravitational pull of dark matter. The map shows large filaments of matter along which visible galaxies and galaxy clusters lie and cosmic voids where very few galaxies reside. The researchers believe that the map will help them to better understand the formation of galaxies and the nature of dark energy.

Manchester United has made an official approach to sign Memphis Depay from PSV Eindhoven. Louis van Gaal, the manager of Manchester United, is eager to sign Depay, who he previously coached on the Dutch national team. Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 league games this season for PSV, and is considered a rising star in the sport.  Depay has been compared to Cristiano Ronaldo by Ed van Steijn, who scouted Ronaldo for Manchester United.  Depay has also been compared to Arjen Robben by his current manager, Phillip Cocu.

Chelsea defeated Manchester City's youth team 3-1 in the Youth Cup semi-final. Tammy Abraham scored twice in the first half, and Dominic Solanke added a third goal late in the game. Chelsea's defense was strong, with Fikayo Tomori and Jake Clarke-Salter combining well to nullify City's attack. City's best player was Brandon Barker, who created a good chance for Manu Garcia.

Marco Rubio, a Republican presidential candidate, believes that people are born with a sexual preference but that same-sex marriage should not be a constitutional right. He believes that states should decide whether or not to allow gay marriage and that the definition of marriage should be between one man and one woman. Rubio has said he would attend the same-sex wedding of a family member or staffer, even if he did not agree with the decision.

Pablo Mandado and Ilze Zebolde are a couple who are cycling around the world. They have no set plans or agenda and are simply living their dream of discovering different parts of the planet. They have been on the road for 356 days, covering almost 7,000 miles and visiting 16 countries. They live on a budget of less than three euros per day, relying on free accommodation, such as camping, couchsurfing, and warmshowers. They started their journey in London and have cycled through Europe, including France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Albania, Macedonia, Greece, and Turkey. They are currently in Armenia and plan to continue their journey through Asia, across the Pacific, and down the length of the American continent.

A Texas couple is suing Premiere Photos, owned by James Evans, after discovering racist slurs printed on their 2012 wedding photo booth pictures. The couple claims Evans refused to apologize and told them to sue him. The couple's attorney, Cathy Hale, says they are seeking an apology and are suing under the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act for negligence and breach of contract. Evans denies the allegations and claims there is no evidence linking his company to the offensive caption. Mediation is scheduled for tomorrow, with a trial set for July if no agreement is reached.

Mike Brown, an England fullback, is taking a cautious approach to recovering from his latest concussion. He suffered the concussion after the France game, and although he wasn't dizzy or concussed during the game, he felt unwell afterward. Brown is determined not to rush his recovery and wants to avoid a long-term break like Johnny Sexton or Geoff Parling. He believes that increased awareness of concussion symptoms, driven by World Rugby online modules, helped him realize he wasn't ready to face Ireland. Brown emphasizes the importance of being honest about concussion symptoms and urges teammates to prioritize their health over playing.

A leading expert, Professor David Spiegelhalter, suggests that the decline in sexual activity among couples in Britain may be due to increased smartphone use. He cites research that shows the frequency of sex has decreased since the emergence of the internet, with couples now having sex three times a month compared to five times a month in 1990. Professor Spiegelhalter attributes this decline to the blurring of boundaries between work and personal life, leading to less time for couples to spend together.

The Tibetan Mastiff, once a status symbol in China, is now being sent to slaughterhouses due to a decline in popularity. The anti-corruption crackdown in China has made it less desirable to give the dogs as gifts, and recent bans on owning large dogs in several cities have also contributed to the decline. The breed's popularity peaked in 2005, with one puppy selling for Â£1.2 million. However, the market has since collapsed, with breeders now selling "imperfect" specimens to slaughterhouses. The dogs are also being stolen from the streets and sold to slaughterhouses.

A survey of 600 women in the Paris area found that every woman surveyed had experienced some form of sexual harassment on public transportation. Half of the women surveyed had experienced harassment before the age of 18. The survey found that women are often conditioned to accept low-level abuse, making them unaware of the extent of the problem. The survey led to calls for a campaign to stop sexist and threatening behavior on public transportation.

Direct Line, an insurance company, held a competition called #everydayfix to design products that solve common everyday problems.  The top ten problems identified were: not being able to sleep, losing keys, being stuck in traffic, losing important documents, nowhere to park, printer not working, running out of phone battery, running out of toilet paper, dealing with automated customer service, and forgetting your bank card.  Three products were chosen as finalists: Snooze, an alarm clock that silences phone notifications; Forget Me Lock, a device that attaches to a key and turns green when the door is unlocked and red when locked; and Nipper, a small mobile phone charger that uses household batteries.  The winner, determined by the most retweets on Twitter with the #everydayfix hashtag, will be funded through a Kickstarter campaign.

Vera Baird, the police and crime commissioner for Northumbria, is under investigation by the Ministry of Justice for allocating over Â£500,000 of public money to a charity she directs, Victims First Northumbria. The charity also has Northumbria's Chief Constable Sue Sim on its board. Critics have called the situation a conflict of interest and an inappropriate use of public funds. The Ministry of Justice is investigating whether any conflict of interest rules were broken.

A group of people, dubbed the "tattoo terrorists," were convicted of assaulting and torturing a 53-year-old man, Greg Valecce, in the basement of the ringleader's mother's house. The ringleader, Corry "Corey" Campbell, believed Valecce had hurt his cat, Pebbles. Campbell, his girlfriend Sandra Ng, and friend Carl Halin beat, tied up, and tattooed Valecce over a period of 42 hours. Valecce suffered multiple injuries and was able to escape and contact police. Campbell and Halin were sentenced to 20 years in prison, while Ng received a 23-month sentence. Two other individuals, David Thomas and Jennifer Pratt, are awaiting sentencing and trial, respectively.

A study of over 12,000 Finnish children found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be overweight as toddlers. The study, published in the journal Pediatrics, found that children who had taken antibiotics as babies were more likely to be overweight by the age of two, especially boys. The researchers believe that antibiotics may be killing off gut bacteria that would normally feed on some of the food eaten, leading to more food being available for the body. They also suggest that killing certain gut bugs may increase appetite. The study highlights the importance of judicious use of antibiotics in infancy, as overuse could be contributing to the worldwide childhood obesity epidemic.

A Queen's Guard slipped on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard ceremony at Buckingham Palace. The incident was caught on camera by a tourist, David Meadwell. The guard, wearing full regalia, fell to the ground, dropping his rifle. He quickly got up, appearing embarrassed. The Ministry of Defence declined to comment on the incident.

A&E, Lifetime, and History will simulcast a remake of the miniseries "Roots" in 2016. The new version will draw more from Alex Haley's novel, "Roots: The Saga of an American Family," and will be more "original" and "contemporary." LeVar Burton, who played Kunta Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new miniseries. The remake will encounter a new generation of viewers who have witnessed Barack Obama become the first African-American president and "12 Years a Slave" win the Oscar for Best Picture.

An Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announced their pregnancy in a rap video set to the theme song of the 90s sitcom "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air." The video, which has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube, features the couple rapping about their journey to parenthood. The video was made to share the news with loved ones living far away. The couple was surprised by the video's popularity, which they say has been "a lot of fun."

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh in the film Gone With the Wind sold for $137,000 at auction. The dress, a jacket and skirt ensemble, was worn in several key scenes in the film, including when Scarlett O'Hara encounters Rhett Butler. The dress was part of a collection of over 300,000 pieces of memorabilia amassed by James Tumblin, who worked in the hair and makeup department at Universal Studios. Tumblin purchased the dress for $20 from the Western Costume Company. Other items from the auction included a straw hat worn by Leigh that sold for $52,500, a suit worn by Clark Gable as Rhett Butler that sold for $55,000, and a black bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia De Havilland that fetched $30,000.

A two-year-old boy fell into a cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his mother dangled him over the edge. The boy was rescued by his parents before emergency personnel arrived. He suffered minor injuries and is in stable condition. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family.

A speed camera in Birmingham, West Midlands, has been turned to face a residential house. The camera has been out of service for two years, as all fixed cameras in the region were decommissioned in 2013 due to outdated technology. The Birmingham City Council is aware of the re-pointed camera and will be sending an engineer to assess the situation. The camera will not be included in a new pilot program using digital technology.

Usain Bolt will compete in the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2 and 3 as part of the Jamaican team. Bolt is excited to be part of the team and is fit and ready to run. He is looking forward to the competition and hopes to make Jamaica proud. The full Jamaican team list will be announced soon.

Neymar and Dani Alves, teammates on the Barcelona football team, showed their support for the club's basketball team by attending the El Clasico match against Real Madrid. Barcelona won the match 85-80, but Real Madrid remains in first place in their division. Neymar also led Brazil to a 1-0 victory over Chile in a football match. Barcelona is currently in first place in La Liga and will play Celta Vigo on Sunday.

Italy is experiencing a surge in migrants from Africa and the Middle East attempting to reach Europe. The Italian Coast Guard rescued 8,480 migrants from Friday to Monday, and received 20 SOS calls on Monday alone. Save the Children reported that 400 migrants may be missing after a ship carrying 550 capsized off the Libyan coast, but the Coast Guard has not confirmed this incident. The International Organization for Migration (IOM) reported that over 10,000 migrants arrived in Italy in the first three months of 2015, with 2,000 rescued in the first weekend of April. Most migrants come from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, using Libya as a transit country. At least 480 migrants have died this year due to bad weather, overcrowded vessels, and abandonment by smugglers.

Alexis Sanchez chose to play for Arsenal over Liverpool, despite interest from both clubs. Sanchez was convinced to join Arsenal by manager Arsene Wenger, and has made an immediate impact on the team, scoring 19 goals this season. Wenger believes Sanchez's quick adaptation to the team proves he is one of the best players in the world. Wenger also praised Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers for his work in developing the team following the sale of Luis Suarez and injury to Daniel Sturridge.

Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break the cycling hour record on June 7th at the Lee Valley Velodrome in London. Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner, will attempt to ride the furthest distance in 60 minutes. The current record is 52.491km, set by Australian Rohan Dennis in February. Wiggins will hope to beat Dennis' record and is expected to set a mark that will last for some time. Tickets for the event will go on sale on April 19th.

Serena Williams won her singles match against Sara Errani in the Fed Cup, but the US team lost the overall match to Italy, relegating them to World Group II. Williams was surprised by the difficulty of the match and realized she needs to adjust her game for the clay court season. The US team will need to work harder to return to the World Group next year.

River Plate is interested in signing former striker Radamel Falcao, who has struggled at Manchester United. River Plate vice president Matias Patanian said the club "dreams of Falcao" and that "the doors are open." Falcao played for River Plate from 2001 to 2009, scoring 34 goals in 90 appearances.

Ella Henderson, a pop star who rose to fame on The X Factor, has partnered with dry shampoo brand Batiste for their 2015 "Ready For It" campaign. This is Henderson's first brand collaboration. The campaign features Henderson in various hairstyles, including a wavy style and a half-ponytail, against a blurred city background. The partnership was facilitated by the MILES agency and launched with a TV advertising campaign featuring Henderson's song "Mirror Man." Henderson expressed her excitement about the collaboration, stating that she uses Batiste regularly. Mark Hargreaves, Henderson's manager, commented on the natural synergy between the artist and the brand, anticipating a successful partnership in 2015.

A billboard featuring the officer who shot and killed Aaron Siler was erected in Kenosha, Wisconsin. The billboard, paid for by the Kenosha Professional Police Association, thanked the community for its support. Siler's family and friends are calling for the billboard to be taken down, saying it is disrespectful. The police association claims no offense was intended and that the billboard was simply to thank the community for its support. The officer, Pablo Torres, is currently on leave pending the outcome of the investigation into the shooting.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in a clash with militants near the Pakistan border. The militants, who crossed into Iran from Pakistan, were from the group Jaish al Adal, a Sunni Muslim group that opposes Iranian influence in Pakistan. The group claimed responsibility for the attack and has been responsible for other attacks on Iranian territory, including one in 2013 that killed 14 Iranian border guards. The Pakistani government condemned the attack and said they are investigating the incident.

Japan's Defense Minister Gen Nakatani told the Diet that the country's Air Self Defense Force (ASDF) has never encountered an extraterrestrial unidentified flying object. He stated that when the ASDF detects indications of an unidentified flying object that could violate Japan's airspace, they scramble fighter jets if necessary and make visual observation. While they sometimes find birds or flying objects other than aircraft, they have never found an unidentified flying object believed to have come from anywhere other than Earth. This response was given to a query from former wrestler-turned-lawmaker Antonio Inoki, who asked if aircraft were ever scrambled to meet extraterrestrial threats and if research was being done into alien visitors.

A 35-year-old passenger, Jin Pai, was hospitalized after breaking a toilet in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport in Hefei, China. He was standing on the toilet rim because he was concerned about its cleanliness. The toilet collapsed, injuring him with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks. He was found bleeding on the floor and taken to a Hefei hospital where he received stitches. Police believe the incident was an accident and reminded people that toilets are for sitting on, not standing on.

Japanese photographer YÃ»ki Aoyama has created a series of photos featuring fathers leaping into the air next to their daughters. The photos, which are part of Aoyama's book "Daughter and Salary Man," feature the daughters looking directly at the camera while their fathers, dressed in suits, pull dramatic poses. The photos are gaining attention online for their unique and humorous nature.

Kevin Pietersen, who was controversially axed from the England team in 2014, is hoping to return to the international set-up after rejoining Surrey. Pietersen was in a jovial mood as he posed for the Surrey team photo, but also looked thoughtful as he considered his potential return to the England team. He joked with photographers and team-mates, and is set to begin the county championship season with Surrey on April 19th.

Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt, a Romanian football club, fired their Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week. Ze Maria was initially fired on Wednesday due to poor performance, but was reinstated the next day. However, after a 2-0 loss to FC Botosani on Saturday, he was fired again. Ze Maria, a former Brazilian international, was replaced by Serbian Vanya Radinovic.

Radamel Falcao's former Monaco teammate, Nabil Dirar, believes Falcao is regretting his move to Manchester United. Falcao has struggled to perform at Manchester United and has only scored four goals this season. Dirar believes Falcao would have been better off staying at Monaco, where he was unhappy but would have played in the Champions League.

A man wearing a distinctive cartoon mask robbed a dairy in Christchurch, New Zealand. The robber, described as very tall and wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt, stole the cash register and approximately $1500 in cash. Police are asking for the public's help in identifying the suspect.

A video of a crocodile swimming through a marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead dog in its mouth has gone viral. The crocodile, which was seen calmly moving through the marina, held onto the dog for hours. The dog, which belonged to the local bike shop owner, went to the water's edge to see the crocodile and was attacked. The crocodile is believed to have come from a nearby sanctuary. Social media users have reacted with horror to the video, with some expressing hatred for crocodiles. However, crocodiles are a common sight in Puerto Vallarta, as the resort is built amongst mangroves that the creatures have called home for centuries.

Hull City lost to Southampton 2-0, leaving them two points above the relegation zone. Despite a strong start to the season, Hull has only won six games and manager Steve Bruce believes they need eight or nine more wins to stay in the Premier League. Bruce is confident that Hull can avoid relegation, despite a difficult schedule that includes games against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham, and Manchester United. He attributes their struggles to long-term injuries to key players, including Michael Dawson, Nikica Jelavic, and Robert Snodgrass. Southampton moved up to fifth in the table after their win, but manager Ronald Koeman had to address Sadio Mane's attempt to take a penalty despite James Ward-Prowse being the designated penalty taker.

Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School in Tewskesbury, Gloucestershire, was banned from the classroom for at least two years after he allowed students to change their answers on their SATs exams. The Department for Education annulled all SATs exam results for the entire school after an investigation found that some pupils had changed answers outside exam conditions and that Guffick had also altered some of the pupils' exam answers himself. Guffick admitted to the allegations and accepted that his actions amounted to unacceptable professional conduct. Although he claimed he only asked students to make their answers more legible, the panel found that no changes of any kind should be made to exam scripts outside test conditions.

Anders Lindegaard, a Manchester United goalkeeper, is enjoying life off the pitch with his wife, Swedish model Misse Beqiri. The couple married in a beach wedding in Mauritius last year and have a son together. Lindegaard has struggled to find playing time at Manchester United and is currently third-choice goalkeeper. He has been told he can leave the club and was linked with a move to FC Midtjylland in January, but the two clubs could not agree on a price.

The 13 letters that once lit up Yankee Stadium failed to sell at a Sotheby's auction, despite an estimated value of $300,000 to $600,000. The letters were owned by Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, who purchased them in 2008 after the stadium's final game. Jackson hoped to sell the letters to a new generation, but no bids were received.  The letters were installed in 1976 and taken down in 2008.  In contrast, a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 60s sold for $112,500, exceeding its estimated value of $20,000 to $30,000.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers has reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe of their professional responsibilities after pictures of them smoking shisha pipes surfaced. Rodgers spoke to the players but will not discipline them. He wants to move on from the incident and focus on the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa. Rodgers also said that he will not reveal whether he will recall Steven Gerrard, who is available after a three-match suspension, for the game. He believes that the team is ready to progress after coming close in the title race last season and the Capital One Cup in January.

Mesut Ozil, Arsenal's German playmaker, returned to London after playing in a Euro 2016 qualifier for Germany. He is expected to start in Arsenal's upcoming match against Liverpool. Ozil has been in good form since returning from injury, scoring three goals and assisting on four others. He has adjusted to English football, enjoying the frequent matches and lack of a winter break.

Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu has stated that the club has no plans to replace manager Luis Enrique, who has a contract until 2016. Bartomeu is very happy with Enrique's performance and says he is impressed with how the manager has performed since taking charge last summer. Enrique is only six games away from winning the La Liga title.

Liverpool midfielder Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with the club. The new deal will run until 2020 and is worth around Â£100,000 a week. Henderson, who joined Liverpool in 2011, has been one of the most improved players under manager Brendan Rodgers. He is expected to replace Steven Gerrard as captain when Gerrard leaves for LA Galaxy this summer.

Filipe Luis, a Chelsea fullback, has stated that he wants to stay at the club until the end of his contract, despite interest from his former team, Atletico Madrid. Luis has struggled to secure the left back position at Chelsea, but he is happy with the club and wants to stay. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is focused on winning the Premier League title and is demanding his players stay focused for the remaining nine games.

Nathan Hughes, a Wasps rugby player, was initially banned for three matches after a disciplinary panel ruled he had been reckless for accidentally knocking out George North, a Welsh rugby player. Hughes was shown a red card for the offense, but that dismissal has now been officially rescinded. The ban was overturned on appeal, as the appeal lodged by Wasps was upheld. The appeal panel concluded that no act of foul play took place in that the incident occurred accidentally.

Wildfires in Siberia have caused dramatic sunsets in the Pacific Northwest. The fires, started by farmers burning grass in their fields, spread rapidly due to strong winds and destroyed dozens of villages. The smoke from the fires was carried across the Pacific Ocean by atmospheric winds, resulting in an amber-colored haze and intense red sunsets in Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia. The smoke particles filter out shorter wavelengths of light, allowing red and orange colors to penetrate the air unfiltered. As the smoke dissipates, air quality will improve and the sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

Becky Schoenig's brand new 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway. After being located by a man who recognized the car, it was returned to her with red rims, red detailing on the sides, and orange accents on the steering wheel. Schoenig was amused by the changes and posted a photo of her car on Facebook, writing that the thieves had "pimped out" her vehicle. While she was happy to have her car back, she is having it professionally cleaned to remove the smell of cigarettes and marijuana. She is also creating a smoothie at her restaurant, The Hot Pot, to honor the man who located her car.

Manchester City players will lose Â£500,000 each in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season. The players have incentivised contracts to stay within financial fairplay rules. City are currently in fourth place, but could fall to fifth if Liverpool wins their next game. The top three teams in the Premier League qualify automatically for the Champions League, while the fourth-place team must win a qualifying round. City has lost seven times since the start of 2015, including early exits in the FA Cup and Champions League. Manager Manuel Pellegrini admitted that the team has "thrown it into the garbage" in the last three months.

Manchester United's Under 18s defeated Manchester City 1-0 in a "mini-derby" match. The match was played at Altrincham's Moss Lane stadium, which has a capacity of 6,000. The match was notable for its high level of skill and commitment, with both teams featuring several talented young players. Callum Gribbin scored the winning goal for United with a free kick, while Marcus Rashford had two chances for City. The result leaves United two points behind leaders Middlesbrough in the Barclays Under 18s Premier League end-of-season play-off series.

Joe Hart, who earned his 50th cap for England, praised Gianluigi Buffon, who earned his 147th cap for Italy, calling him a "legend of the game." Hart, who is 10 years younger than Buffon, said he looks up to Buffon and is inspired by him. Hart is proud of his 50 caps and wants to continue playing for England.

Chipotle Mexican Grill has partnered with the Postmates app to offer delivery services in 67 cities. The delivery service will charge a 9% service fee, with Postmates delivery fees starting at $5. Chipotle is not the only restaurant chain to enter the delivery market, as Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King have all announced plans to offer delivery services.

The parents of Martin Richard, the youngest victim of the Boston Marathon bombings, are asking the Justice Department to drop the death penalty for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the man convicted of the crime. They argue that the death penalty would prolong the legal process and force them to relive the painful events of that day. The Richards believe that Tsarnaev should spend the rest of his life in prison without the possibility of release. They want to move on from the tragedy and focus on the future.

A mystery billionaire has spent Â£400 million customizing a Boeing 747-8 jumbo jet to be his personal luxury home. The plane, which normally carries 600 passengers, has been transformed to accommodate a single tycoon and dozens of guests. It features a dining room with an adjoining kitchen, a lounge, a state room, an aeroloft with eight beds, a master bedroom, a conference room, and a main suite that resembles a hotel room. The plane also includes a lounge area with televisions and a space for guests to relax.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying an uncrewed Dragon spacecraft to the International Space Station. The rocket landed on a floating barge, but tipped over. SpaceX hopes to reuse rockets to reduce the cost of space travel. The Dragon will deliver supplies to the space station and return with science experiments and trash. This is SpaceX's sixth mission to the International Space Station.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding to be held at the Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel inside the Westgate Hotel in Las Vegas on April 23rd. The winning couple will be announced next Monday and will receive a free wedding reception, a two-night hotel suite, airfare, and concert tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show. The chapel is part of the first permanent Graceland exhibit of Elvis's artifacts outside of his Memphis home.

Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson believes his team can catch Manchester City in the Premier League after a tough season. Henderson and goalkeeper Simon Mignolet both played their 47th game of the season in the 2-0 win over Newcastle United, equaling the record for appearances in the top five European leagues. Henderson believes that after recent wins, Liverpool can put pressure on City, who are four points ahead in the race for the Champions League. Raheem Sterling scored the first goal in the ninth minute, followed by Joe Allen's first Anfield goal in the 70th minute. Allen admitted that he thought Newcastle should have been awarded a penalty when Dejan Lovren appeared to foul Ayoze Perez in the area.

Roma defeated Napoli in a key Serie A match on Saturday, ending their four-month winless streak at home. Miralem Pjanic scored the only goal in the 25th minute, finishing off a swift counter-attack. Roma goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis made several key saves in the second half to preserve the victory. The win moved Roma provisionally four points ahead of city rivals Lazio, while Napoli's winless streak extended to five matches. Security was tight for the match due to a fan death following a shooting before last season's Italian Cup final.

Doncaster Rovers and Fleetwood Town played a 0-0 draw at the Keepmoat Stadium. The match was uneventful, leaving the Doncaster media team with little to show in their match highlights video. They created a 27-second video with only 14 seconds of match action, showing the kick-off, a goal kick, and the final whistle.

Roland Giroux has a unique bond with his blood parrot cichlid, a hybrid fish bred in Taiwan. He hand-feeds and massages his fish daily, which has become increasingly social and enjoys the interaction. The fish even swims up Giroux's arm and circles his fingers, showing a clear affection for its owner.

Ben Stokes is a fiery character on the England cricket team who has a history of aggressive behavior, including punching a locker after being dismissed. Stokes has been involved in a clash with Marlon Samuels during a recent Test match, but has since responded positively to the row after talking to England coach Peter Moores. Stokes is a valuable asset to the team and England wants to help him reach his full potential.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium on June 12th has sold out at the Cardiff City Stadium. The match is a crucial one for Wales, who are in their best position to qualify for a major tournament since 1958. Wales and Belgium are tied for first place in Group B with 11 points each, but Belgium is ahead on goal difference. Wales' recent 3-0 victory over Israel has increased expectations that they can qualify for the 2016 finals in France. The Football Association of Wales has been inundated with ticket requests, and general admission tickets have sold out. The Wales squad prefers to play at the Cardiff City Stadium, which has a more intimate atmosphere than the Millennium Stadium.

England's Under-17 team, the defending champions, will compete in the UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria next month. The team, which qualified with a perfect record, is placed in Group D with Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland. Their first match is against Italy on May 7th. The squad includes players from several Premier League clubs, including Chelsea, Arsenal, and Liverpool.  Chris Willock of Arsenal has been called up to the squad for the first time.

Manchester City is interested in signing 14-year-old Anderlecht player Evangelos Patoulidis. Patoulidis is considered one of the best young players from Anderlecht's youth program and has also attracted interest from Arsenal and Barcelona. He previously rejected a move to Barcelona's academy when he was 12, but has continued to impress. City has spoken with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock about a potential transfer.

Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old transgender escort from Mexico, was found strangled and beaten to death in her Fulham flat in late March. A 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with her death and has been bailed pending further questioning. Police are appealing to anyone who may have had contact with Miss Santillan in the hours before her death.

Dawn, who has suffered seven miscarriages, appeared on The Jeremy Kyle show to confront her friend Jamie, who stole money she had saved for a headstone for her son Daniel James. Dawn had saved Â£207 for the headstone, but it went missing. She suspected Jamie and his girlfriend Carol, and a lie detector test revealed that Jamie had taken the money. Jamie confessed to taking the money in a Facebook message to Dawn, blaming his girlfriend Carol. Dawn was devastated by the betrayal and left the show in tears.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis, mostly women and children, as well as the ill and elderly. The release was coordinated by Arab tribal leaders and the freed Yazidis were taken to the Kurdish regional capital, Irbil. This is not the first time ISIS has released Yazidis, as they have previously released scores of children and elderly. The Yazidis are a Kurdish minority group whose religion is considered a pre-Islamic sect. ISIS has been responsible for the persecution of the Yazidis, including slaughtering them by the hundreds and enslaving women.

Harry Kane, a Tottenham Hotspur striker, is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Year awards. He has had a remarkable season, scoring 20 Premier League goals, including a long-range strike against Chelsea, a headed goal against Arsenal, and his first goal for England. A video, produced by Copa90, uses still photographs of Kane to create an animated effect, showcasing some of his best goals and celebrations. The video, titled "Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?", was released ahead of the awards ceremony on Sunday, where Kane is competing against Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez for the top prize.

Jamie Carragher believes Brendan Rodgers is the right man to lead Liverpool despite a trophyless season and a likely finish outside the top four. Carragher believes the team needs to improve and that the signings made last summer need to be the right ones. Carragher also received a Beacon Award for his community work on Merseyside through his 23 Foundation.

Four-year-old James Hayward had his toy gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport because security officers deemed it a security risk. His father, Phil, criticized the security staff for being "over-zealous" and said that the situation was "ludicrous." East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience but defended their decision, stating that they are required to follow government regulations that prohibit any items resembling prohibited items from being brought through security.

A 31-year-old man named Rich, living in Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend/wife. Rich described himself as athletic, tattooed, and financially successful, and outlined his requirements for a partner, including being a non-drinker and non-smoker, fit and attractive, good with her hands, a good cook, and great in bed. He also stated that he is willing to provide a gym membership, phone, and other benefits to the successful candidate.

FA chairman Greg Dyke is pushing for radical changes to increase the number of homegrown players in Premier League squads from eight to twelve. He is facing opposition from the Premier League, but has the support of five former England managers: Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson, and Steve McClaren. The managers believe that England's failure to win any major honors since 1966 is due in part to a shrinking pool of English talent playing at the top level. They argue that while England is producing talented young players, they are not being given enough opportunities to play.

Demelza Poldark, played by Eleanor Tomlinson, gives birth to a baby girl in the next episode of Poldark. Fans have commented on the show's fast-paced pregnancies, as Demelza goes from announcing her pregnancy to giving birth in a matter of minutes. This is reminiscent of the previous pregnancy in the show, where Elizabeth, another love interest of Ross Poldark, also gave birth in a short amount of time.

Leicester City manager Nigel Pearson has urged his players to focus on their own games and not worry about their relegation rivals. Despite their recent wins, Pearson is wary of his team getting overconfident and wants them to stay focused on their own performance. He believes that Leicester's future is in their own hands and that they have a realistic chance of survival if they continue to perform well.

A gray whale named Varvara swam nearly 14,000 miles from her feeding ground off Russia's Sakhalin Island to Baja, Mexico, breaking the record for the longest mammal migration. This journey was surprising because Varvara visited three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales, suggesting she may be an eastern gray whale, not a western gray whale as previously thought. This discovery could mean that the number of western gray whales, which are endangered, is even lower than previously believed.

A landslide on the Shiretoko Peninsula near Rausu, Hokkaido Island, Japan, caused a section of seabed to rise as high as 50 feet above sea level. The new landmass is approximately 1,000-1,640 feet long and 100 feet wide. Local residents were surprised by the sudden appearance of the land, as they did not hear any sounds or feel any tremors. Geologists believe the landslide was caused by melting ice and snow, which caused a section of land to drop and pivot the underwater area into the air. Authorities do not expect the landmass to expand further and believe the event is unrelated to the recent earthquake in Nepal.

Gregory van der Wiel has denied rumors that he will leave Paris Saint-Germain in the summer. He says he is happy in Paris and wants to sign a new contract. He recently had a disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc after being dropped from the Champions League match against Chelsea. However, he says he is ready to play whenever called upon. PSG is rumored to be interested in Barcelona star Dani Alves, which could lead to Van der Wiel's departure.

Carlos Tevez has requested to terminate his contract with Juventus to return to his former club Boca Juniors in Argentina. Juventus is reluctant to lose their top scorer, but they have accepted his request and are looking for a replacement. Boca Juniors has confirmed that they are close to completing a deal for Tevez, but he must terminate his contract with Juventus first. Tevez's international manager, Tata Martino, has stated that Tevez's decision will not affect his future with the Argentina national team.

Bayern Munich defeated Porto 6-1 in the Champions League quarter-final, securing a spot in the semi-finals. Bayern's manager, Pep Guardiola, ripped a hole in his trousers during the match, revealing his underwear. Bayern's victory was a dominant performance, with goals from Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso, and two from Robert Lewandowski.

A multi-vehicle crash involving three cars occurred on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale. Ten people, including four children, were involved. Two adults and two children were flown to the Princess Alexandra Hospital by helicopter, while six others were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries. The highway was closed for several hours while emergency crews worked to free a trapped person and clear the scene.

Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil received a new Apple Watch and shared his excitement on Instagram, comparing it to Michael Knight's watch from the show Knight Rider. Ozil is expected to start for Arsenal in their upcoming match against Chelsea. Arsenal trails Chelsea by 10 points with six games remaining, but has been boosted by the return of Jack Wilshere. Former Arsenal player Ray Parlour believes that Wilshere has the potential to be a key player for the club, but his fitness is a concern.

Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby between Manchester United and Manchester City at Old Trafford. Clattenburg has sent off three players from both teams this season, including City captain Vincent Kompany. Despite this, Clattenburg is considered one of the Premier League's top referees. The derby is especially important as United are currently in second place, one point ahead of City.

Bob Katter, a federal MP from Queensland, has been accused of racism after he stated that the Queensland Government believed embattled MP Billy Gordon was "a little black puppet on a string." Katter, who is of Lebanese descent, said he has experienced racism from both major parties and sympathizes with Gordon's position. Katter's statement was in response to the Queensland Government's assumption that Gordon would resign after being accused of domestic violence and withholding his criminal history. Katter believes the government's assumption was based on racial prejudice, and he used the term "black puppet" to highlight this. He defended his statement by saying he used the term because he is "dark" and comes from Cloncurry.

Dayna Dobias, a 19-year-old from Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy. She has created videos of herself dancing to challenge stereotypes about people with disabilities. Dobias says she wants to inspire others and show that people with disabilities can do anything. She has also begun motivational speaking at local schools.

Manchester United's Javier Hernandez is attracting interest from Orlando City, as well as eight other European clubs. Hernandez is looking to leave Manchester United after a difficult loan spell at Real Madrid. Meanwhile, Manchester United has made a revised contract offer to 19-year-old Andreas Pereira, who has also attracted interest from several European clubs.

Early Saturday morning, a group of three or more people attempted to carjack a man pumping gas at a 76 gas station in South Los Angeles. When the man ran away, the group doused his car in gasoline and set it on fire. The driver and two passengers escaped unharmed, but the car was completely destroyed. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as arson.

Charles Manuel, a chiropractor in Lamoni, Iowa, surrendered his license after admitting to exchanging sexual favors for services and performing exorcisms on patients. Despite these actions, Manuel received perfect five-star ratings on HealthGrades.com from the three patients who submitted reviews. Manuel is prohibited from practicing chiropractic in Iowa for at least 10 years, but he can apply for reinstatement after that time if he can prove that the circumstances surrounding the revocation of his license no longer exist.

The United States is complaining to Russia about a Russian SU-27 fighter jet intercepting a U.S. RC-135U reconnaissance plane over the Baltic Sea. The Pentagon claims the Russian pilot's actions were "unsafe and unprofessional" due to aggressive maneuvers performed in close proximity to the U.S. aircraft. Russia claims the U.S. plane was flying toward the Russian border with its transponder switched off, but the U.S. denies this. This is not the first time the U.S. has complained about an incident involving a RC-135U and a SU-27.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from his car in the parking lot of the Marriott Springhill Suites in Salt Lake City. The rifle was secured in a hard case with padlocks and chains, but the thief broke the car window, tied a rope around the case, and used another vehicle to pull the case free. The theft occurred just days before President Obama visited Utah, and the Secret Service was notified of the theft. The agent's other belongings were found at a nearby hotel, but the rifle has not been recovered.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of murdering his neighbor Terrence Freebody in July 2012. Forensic psychiatrist Professor Paul Mullen believes Costa was suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the murder. Professor Mullen stated that Costa's mental state was compromised by dementia and alcohol, which led to a confused state. The prosecution believes Costa was feigning his failing memory, but Professor Mullen denied these claims. Costa's state of mind is critical to the case, as the jury can return a not guilty verdict if Costa's unstable mindset at the time of the attack can be proven.

Everton won their match against Burnley 1-0, but not without a penalty controversy. Ross Barkley took the penalty, despite Leighton Baines being on the pitch, and missed. Manager Roberto Martinez defended Barkley's decision, stating that he is happy to have multiple players who can take penalties and that Barkley showed responsibility by taking the shot.

Two passengers were found dead in their stateroom on the ms Ryndam cruise ship. The cruise line, Holland America, is cooperating with the FBI in the investigation, which is currently underway. The ship departed from Tampa, Florida on March 29th and is currently in San Juan, Puerto Rico.

Patrick Kluivert, former Holland forward and assistant coach, has led Curacao to the second round of CONCACAF World Cup qualifying for the 2018 tournament. Curacao drew 2-2 in the second leg against Montserrat, winning 4-3 on aggregate. Kluivert's team will face Cuba in the next round on June 8 and 16.

Esteban Cambiasso, a former Inter Milan star, has won many trophies in his career, but he says that keeping Leicester City in the Premier League would be just as important as winning a trophy. Cambiasso joined Leicester in the summer after a ten-year stint in Italy and has quickly become a key player. He is happy in the East Midlands and could stay beyond his current one-year deal.

Gemma, a 23-year-old mother of two, is at risk of being banned from seeing her children by her mother, Debbie, because of her partying and drinking habits. Gemma gave her two children to Debbie when they were four months old, and Debbie has been raising them ever since. Debbie claims that Gemma is constantly drinking and partying, and that she stole an iPad from one of the children to fund her lifestyle. Gemma admits to stealing money and other items from her mother in the past, but denies stealing the iPad. Debbie is now threatening to ban Gemma from seeing the children because she doesn't trust her.

During a Chelsea vs. Manchester United match, Chelsea captain John Terry made a strong challenge from behind on United striker Radamel Falcao, which led to a loose ball that Chelsea used to score a goal. Sky Sports pundits Thierry Henry, Jamie Redknapp, and Graeme Souness all agreed that Terry's challenge was a foul, despite the beauty of the goal.

Lady Antebellum singer Hillary Scott's tour bus caught fire on a Texas freeway Thursday morning. Everyone on board was safely evacuated after a rear tire blew out. The fire destroyed everything in the bus's back lounge except Scott's Bible. The band is set to perform at the 50th Academy of Country Music Awards on Sunday in Arlington, Texas.

A Scottish scientist is working on a laser that will convert sunlight into energy. The satellites will orbit the earth, covered in mirrors to help it harvest the sunlight and convert it into laser light. The energy it then creates, using semi-conductors, can be shot back down to earth. If it works, it could mean solar power could even become viable in Scotland, or be able to restore power instantly to disaster hit areas.  While the lasers are not powerful enough to be used as weapons, the scientist acknowledges that there may be concerns about who controls the satellites.

V. Stiviano was ordered to pay back over $2.6 million in gifts she received from Donald Sterling after his wife, Shelly Sterling, sued her. Shelly Sterling claimed that Stiviano targeted wealthy older men and that Donald Sterling used their money to buy Stiviano expensive gifts, including a Ferrari, two Bentleys, a Range Rover, and a $1.8 million duplex. Stiviano argued that there was nothing wrong with the gifts and that she never took advantage of Donald Sterling.

Thierry Henry believes Arsenal needs to sign four top players in the summer to win the Premier League title. He believes they need a goalkeeper, center back, defensive midfielder, and striker. Henry specifically criticized Olivier Giroud, stating that Arsenal will struggle to win the league with him as their main striker. He used Chelsea as an example, stating that they won the league after signing Thibaut Courtois, Nemanja Matic, Cesc Fabregas, and Diego Costa. Henry believes Arsenal needs to sign players of a similar caliber to those four players.

Serge Gnabry, a 19-year-old midfielder for Arsenal, is recovering from a serious knee injury that sidelined him for over a year. He recently played 90 minutes for Arsenal's Under 21s, marking his return to the field. Gnabry is feeling "better and better" and is looking forward to his next game.

Jacob Phillips, a 23-year-old accountant, died after falling 70 feet down a cliff in Penarth, South Wales. Phillips had been out drinking with friends in Cardiff and had taken a taxi home. When the group realized they did not have enough money to pay the fare, they ran from the taxi driver. Phillips ran in the dark and fell down the cliff, which was at the end of the disused Northern Promenade. The coroner ruled the death an accident, stating that Phillips likely became disoriented and was unaware of the danger of the cliff.

The UK Passport Office made a Â£42 million profit last year while thousands of holidaymakers who were affected by passport delays did not receive compensation. The Passport Office approved only 2,191 compensation applications, totaling Â£203,066, while managers received up to Â£3,500 in bonuses. The Home Affairs Committee called for blanket compensation for those affected, but the government refused, citing the creation of a precedent.

A semi-detached home in Horfield, Bristol, built in the 1930s, is up for auction. The house has remained largely untouched since its construction and features original details such as stained-glass windows, oil-fired central heating, and vintage food items. The home also boasts an original bathroom and kitchen, wood-paneled hallway, and vintage cupboards. While some features have been upgraded, such as double-glazed windows, the auctioneers believe the cost of renovations could deter developers. The house is expected to sell for between Â£200,000 and Â£250,000.

Colin Kaepernick became the starting quarterback for the San Francisco 49ers in 2012 after Alex Smith suffered a concussion. He led the team to the Super Bowl in 2013, where they lost to the Baltimore Ravens.
Soul Food is a 1997 American comedy-drama film produced by Kenneth "Babyface" Edmonds, Tracey Edmonds, and Robert Teitel and released by Fox 2000 Pictures.

Anne Rice was born in New Orleans and later moved to Texas and San Francisco. Route 495 is a 3.45 mile freeway in New Jersey that connects the New Jersey Turnpike to New York State Route 495 inside the Lincoln Tunnel, providing access to Midtown Manhattan.
Telemundo is an American Spanish-language television network owned by Comcast through its NBCUniversal division, NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises.

Damon Albarn, a British musician, formed the band Blur with Graham Coxon after meeting at Stanway School. Blur's debut album, *Leisure*, was released in 1991. Albarn's debut solo album, *Everyday Robots*, was released in 2014 and featured collaborations with Brian Eno, Natasha Khan, and the Leytonstone City Pentecostal Mission Church Choir.
Mogadishu, also known as Hamar, is the capital and most populous city of Somalia. As the capital, Mogadishu is home to many important national institutions.
"Happiness in Slavery" is a song by Nine Inch Nails, featured on their 1992 EP, *Broken*.
Andrew Kevin Walker, born August 14, 1964, is an American screenwriter who has been nominated for a BAFTA award.

The 2007 film *Shooter* follows Bob Lee Swagger, a Force Recon veteran framed for murder by a private military company. The TV series *Shooter* features Ryan Phillippe as Bob Lee Swagger, an expert marksman living in exile who is drawn back into action to stop an assassination attempt on the president.
"House" (also known as "House, M.D.") is an American medical drama television series that aired on the Fox network for eight seasons, from November 16, 2004 to May 21, 2012.

Charles Manson was found guilty of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder for the deaths of seven people, including actress Sharon Tate. He was also convicted of the murders of Gary Hinman and Donald "Shorty" Shea. After Manson was charged with these crimes, recordings of his songs were released commercially.

Sean Penn is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He began his acting career in television and made his film debut in 1981. Penn gained critical acclaim for his roles in crime dramas in the 1980s and 1990s. He has received numerous awards for his acting, including two Academy Awards for Best Actor.

Sir Donald Bradman, also known as "The Don," was an Australian cricketer widely considered the greatest batsman of all time. After retiring, he continued to be involved in the sport as an administrator, selector, and writer for 30 years.

L.A. Reid has held several high-ranking positions in the music industry, including chairman and CEO of Epic Records, president and CEO of Arista Records, and chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group.

Brad Wilk is a drummer best known for his work with Rage Against the Machine and Audioslave. He began his career with the band Greta in 1990 and co-founded Rage Against the Machine in 1991. As of 2016, he is a member of Prophets of Rage.

The Millers was a multi-camera sitcom that aired on CBS for two seasons, from October 3, 2013 to July 18, 2015. The show was canceled by CBS on November 14, 2014, after only four episodes of its second season.

Dorothy Ann Willis Richards was an American politician who served as the 45th Governor of Texas from 1991 to 1995. She was a Democrat who gained national attention as the state treasurer of Texas when she delivered the keynote address at the 1988 Democratic National Convention. Richards was the second female governor of Texas and was known for her outspoken feminism and her one-liners.
Drake Bell released an EP titled "A Reminder" independently in 2011.
Boardwalk is a 1979 American drama film written by Stephen Verona and Leigh Chapman and directed by Verona. Janet Leigh, an American actress, singer, dancer, and author, starred in the film.

SimoÌn BolÃ­var, also known as El Libertador, was a Venezuelan military and political leader who led the fight for independence from Spain for Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Panama.
The Bermuda Triangle is a region in the western North Atlantic Ocean where many ships and aircraft have reportedly vanished under mysterious circumstances.

Colin Kaepernick became the starting quarterback for the San Francisco 49ers in 2012 after Alex Smith suffered a concussion. He led the team to the Super Bowl in 2013, losing to the Baltimore Ravens. In 2013, Kaepernick's first full season as a starter, he led the 49ers to the NFC Championship, where they lost to the Seattle Seahawks.
Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

Advertising is a non-personal form of marketing communication that uses audio or visual messages to promote products, services, or ideas. It is distinct from personal selling because it is not directed at a specific individual. Advertising is delivered through various mass media, including traditional media like newspapers, magazines, television, radio, outdoor advertising, and direct mail, as well as newer media like search results, blogs, websites, and text messages.
"Private Lives" is a play written by NoÃ«l Coward in 1930 and a film adaptation directed by Sidney Franklin in 1931.
Maurice Harold Macmillan, 1st Earl of Stockton, was a British Conservative politician and statesman who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from January 10, 1957 to October 19, 1963.

Aristotle, a Greek philosopher and scientist, was born in Stagira, Greece. He studied at Plato's Academy in Athens from the age of 17 to 37. After Plato's death, Aristotle tutored Alexander the Great at the request of Philip II of Macedon.

David Packouz is an American entrepreneur who was formerly an arms dealer. He is also a musician, inventor, and the CEO of Singular Sound, a music technology company. Packouz invented the BeatBuddy, a guitar pedal drum machine.

Magic Johnson was a point guard for the Lakers for 13 seasons. He won five NBA championships with the Lakers, including one in his rookie season. He retired for four years before returning to play 32 games for the Lakers in 1996. Johnson is a successful businessman and was a part-owner of the Lakers for several years.

Tenacious D is a comedy rock duo from Los Angeles, California, formed in 1994 by Jack Black and Kyle Gass. The band has released three albums and gained popularity after starring in their own television series in 1997.

James VI and I, also known as James Stuart, was King of Scotland from 1567 and King of England and Ireland from 1603 until his death in 1625. He ruled over Scotland and England as separate sovereign states, each with its own parliament, judiciary, and laws. James advocated for a single parliament for both countries, achieving most of his goals in Scotland but facing many difficulties in England, including the Gunpowder Plot and conflicts with Parliament.

Big Brother 2017, also known as Big Brother 18, is the upcoming 18th season of the British reality television series Big Brother. The show is hosted by Emma Willis and narrated by Marcus Bentley, who has narrated the show since its inception in 2000. Bentley is a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist known for his distinctive Geordie accent.

Saxony is a landlocked state in Germany, bordering other German states as well as Poland and the Czech Republic. It is the tenth largest state in Germany by area and the sixth most populous, with a population of 4 million. The history of Saxony spans over a millennium, and it is known for its wine region, which is one of the northernmost in Europe.
East End Park was a major league baseball stadium in Cincinnati, Ohio. The song "In the End" was written by the American rock band Linkin Park.
Mel B. Brown's solo career began with the release of "I Want You Back" featuring Missy Elliott on Virgin Records.
Noah Cyrus is the youngest daughter of Billy Ray Cyrus and the younger sister of Miley Cyrus and Trace Cyrus.

"Mohra" is a 1994 Indian action thriller film directed by Rajiv Rai and starring Akshay Kumar, Sunil Shetty, Raveena Tandon, and Naseeruddin Shah. The film was released on July 1, 1994, and became the second highest-grossing Indian film of that year. It received nine Filmfare nominations in 1995. Originally, Divya Bharti was cast as the female lead and filmed many scenes, but after her death, Raveena Tandon replaced her. The film is also known for its popular songs.
The song "Hourglass" was created by the British electronic duo Disclosure. The song is featured on singer-songwriter James Taylor's fourteenth studio album.
Shane Black is an American screenwriter, director, producer, and actor. He is best known for writing the 1987 action film *Lethal Weapon* and directing the 2005 film *Kiss Kiss Bang Bang*.
"A View to a Kill" (1985) is the 14th James Bond film and the last to feature Roger Moore as the secret agent.
Papua is the largest and easternmost province of Indonesia, encompassing most of western New Guinea. It was previously known as Irian Jaya and included all of Indonesian New Guinea.
Augustus likely died of natural causes, though some believe his wife Livia poisoned him.

Jennifer Lopez began her music career in 1999 with her debut album, "On the 6." In 2001, she became the first woman to have a number one album and film in the same week with the release of her second album, "J.Lo," and the film, "The Wedding Planner." After her second divorce, Lopez's relationship with Ben Affleck influenced her third album, "This Is Me... Then." She later married Marc Anthony and rebounded with the success of the film, "Shall We Dance?" After giving birth to twins in 2008, Lopez returned to prominence in 2011 with her role as a judge on "American Idol" and the release of her most commercially successful single, "On the Floor."

Working animals are domesticated animals trained to perform tasks for humans. These animals can be close companions, like guide dogs, or used for labor, like draft horses. They can also be trained for milking or herding. While wild animals can be tamed and trained, they are rarely used for work due to their lack of trustworthiness and mild temper.

Billboard Dad is a 1998 American direct-to-video comedy film directed by Alan Metter and starring Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen. Billboard magazine publishes two music charts: Top Latin Albums, the most important chart for Spanish language albums in the American market, and Regional Mexican Albums, a genre-specific chart.

"Vedam" is a 2010 Telugu-language Indian drama film written and directed by Radhakrishna Jagarlamudi. The film stars Allu Arjun, Manoj Manchu, Anushka Shetty, Manoj Bajpayee, Saranya Ponvannan, Deeksha Seth, Lekha Washington, and Siya Gautham.
Men in Black II is a 2002 American science fiction action comedy film starring Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rosario Dawson, Tony Shalhoub, and Rip Torn.
Sancho Panza is the squire of Don Quixote in the novel *Don Quixote* by Miguel de Cervantes. He is known for his humorous, ironic, and witty comments, called "sanchismos."
The Adventures of Pluto Nash is a 2002 science fiction action comedy film starring Eddie Murphy in a dual role and directed by Ron Underwood.
The world premiere of Hedda Gabler, a play by Henrik Ibsen, took place on January 31, 1891 at the Residenztheater in Munich. Ibsen was present at the premiere.
Brazzers is a pornographic production company located in Montreal, Canada.
Timothy Simon Roth is an English actor and director born on May 14, 1961.

Juventus Football Club, nicknamed Juve, is an Italian professional football club founded in 1897 by young students in Turin. It is the second oldest active football club in Italy, after Genoa. The club's traditional home kit is black and white stripes, and they currently play at the 41,507-capacity Juventus Stadium.

Viola Davis had supporting and minor roles in several films and television series in the late 1990s and early 2000s, including the films *Kate & Leopold* (2001) and *Far from Heaven* (2002), and the television series *Law & Order: Special Victims Unit*.

Jenna Jameson, born Jenna Marie Massoli on April 9, 1974, is an American entrepreneur, webcam model, and former pornographic film actress. She is known as the world's most famous adult entertainment performer and "The Queen of Porn." Jameson began acting in erotic videos in 1993 after working as a stripper and glamor model.
The New Orleans Pelicans are a team in the National Basketball Association (NBA) and are part of the Western Conference Southwest Division.

Starrcade was an annual professional wrestling event held from 1983 to 2000 by the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) and later World Championship Wrestling (WCW). It was originally broadcast via closed-circuit television and eventually broadcast via pay-per-view television.  Starrcade was a tradition that began in the 1960s and 1970s with JCP holding major professional wrestling events on Thanksgiving and Christmas, mostly at Greensboro Coliseum.

Jack Ryan Falahee is an American actor known for his roles as Connor Walsh on the ABC television legal drama *How to Get Away with Murder* and Benjamin Stringfellow on the PBS historical drama *Mercy Street*.

Seohyun, a member of the popular South Korean girl group Girls' Generation, debuted as a solo artist on January 17, 2017, with her mini album *Don't Say No*. This makes her the third member of Girls' Generation to debut as a solo artist.  She is also known for her acting career, having starred in stage musicals such as *Moon Embracing the Sun*, *Gone with the Wind*, and *Mamma Mia*.

The Apple II, designed by Steve Wozniak, was one of the first successful mass-produced home computers. The Apple II series, manufactured by Apple Computer, was introduced in 1977. Steve Wozniak, nicknamed "Woz," is an American inventor, engineer, programmer, philanthropist, and entrepreneur who co-founded Apple Inc.
A&E is an American cable and satellite television channel owned equally by the Hearst Corporation and the Walt Disney Company.

L.A. Reid has held several high-ranking positions in the music industry, including chairman and CEO of Epic Records, president and CEO of Arista Records, chairman and CEO of Island Def Jam Music Group, founder and CEO of Hitco Music Publishing, and co-founder of LaFace Records.

There are two films titled "Veeram (Valour)": one is a 2014 Indian Tamil action film directed by Siva and produced by Vijaya Productions, and the other is a 2016 Indian epic historical drama film written and directed by Jayaraj.

"Home for the Holidays" is a horror film that premiered on ABC in 1972, starring Sally Field, Eleanor Parker, Julie Harris, Jessica Walter, and Walter Brennan. A second film with the same name was released in 1995, starring Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr., Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning, Dylan McDermott, Geraldine Chaplin, Steve Guttenberg, Cynthia Stevenson, Claire Danes, Austin Pendleton, and David Strathairn.
Taran Killam is an American actor, comedian, and writer born on April 1, 1982.
The Sex Factor is an online reality TV series produced by xHamster where eight men and eight women compete to become porn stars.
John Hovig Dolmayan is a Lebanese-born Armenian-American songwriter and drummer born on July 15, 1973.
Island Records is a British-American record label owned by Universal Music Group.
Sikkim is a state located in northeastern India.
Christa McAuliffe was a social studies teacher at Concord High School in New Hampshire from 1983.
Ron Weasley is a fictional character in J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series.
"Reign Over Me" is a 2007 American drama film written and directed by Mike Binder, produced by his brother Jack Binder, and distributed by Columbia Pictures. The film was released on March 23, 2007.
Colin Kaepernick is an American football quarterback who is currently a free agent. He was born on November 3, 1987.

Sheryl Lee appeared in the film *CafeÌ Society* in 2016 and reprised her role as Laura Palmer in the Showtime revival of *Twin Peaks* in 2017. Sheryl Lee Ralph played Madame Morrible in the Broadway production of *Wicked* in 2016.
Matteo Renzi, born January 11, 1975, is an Italian politician who served as Prime Minister of Italy from February 2014 to December 2016.
The animated film "The Road to El Dorado" stars Kevin Kline, Kenneth Branagh, Armand Assante, Jim Cummings, Edward James Olmos, Tobin Bell, and Rosie Perez.

Selena Gomez's song "Same Old Love" is from her second studio album, *Revival*, released in 2015. The album debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart, and the first three singles, including "Same Old Love," topped the Mainstream Top 40 chart in the United States.
Weekly Idol is a show hosted by comedian Jeong Hyeong-don and rapper Defconn.

Heavy metal music originated in the late 1960s and early 1970s in the United Kingdom and the United States.  Bands like Iron Maiden and Saxon, part of the new wave of British heavy metal, emerged in the late 1970s and continued the genre's tradition.
Ashton Kutcher starred in several romantic comedies, including "Guess Who," "A Lot Like Love," "What Happens in Vegas," and "No Strings Attached."

Topman is a British men's clothing retailer owned by the Arcadia Group, which also owns several other clothing brands. Topman has stores throughout the United Kingdom and in six Irish cities and towns.

The Industrial Revolution transformed Wales from an agricultural society to an industrial nation. The development of mining and metallurgical industries, particularly the South Wales Coalfield, led to a rapid increase in the country's population.
Tool is a band that has won three Grammy Awards, toured internationally, and had chart-topping albums in multiple countries.
YouTube is an American video-sharing website headquartered in San Bruno, California. It is the second most popular website in the world, according to web traffic analysis company Alexa Internet.
Sidse Babett Knudsen is a Danish actress born on November 22, 1968. She works in theatre, television, and film.
Conrad Dunn's first major film role was as Francis "Psycho" Soyer in the 1981 film "Stripes."  The film also featured the first significant roles for John Larroquette, John Diehl, and Judge Reinhold.
The film "Raees" stars Shah Rukh Khan, Mahira Khan, and Nawazuddin Siddiqui.
Asylum Records is an American record label founded in 1971 by David Geffen and Elliot Roberts.
Trollhunters is an American animated fantasy television series created by Guillermo del Toro for Netflix. It was produced by DreamWorks Animation and Double Dare You.

The Armenian Genocide, also known as the Armenian Holocaust, was the systematic extermination of 1.5 million Armenians by the Ottoman government between 1915 and 1923. The Ottoman government also targeted other indigenous and Christian ethnic groups, such as the Assyrians and Ottoman Greeks, for extermination.
Marcus Morgan Bentley is a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist born on October 4, 1967.

William Jefferson Clinton, born August 19, 1946, served as the 42nd President of the United States from 1993 to 2001. His first inauguration as president took place on January 20, 1993, on the West Front of the United States Capitol Building in Washington, D.C.

Danny Boyle is an English director, producer, screenwriter, and theatre director known for films such as *Shallow Grave*, *Trainspotting*, *The Beach*, *28 Days Later*, *Sunshine*, *Slumdog Millionaire*, *127 Hours*, and *Steve Jobs*. *The Beach*, a 2000 adventure drama film directed by Boyle, is based on the 1996 novel of the same name by Alex Garland, adapted for the film by John Hodge.

The image of a dress went viral on social media, generating over 10 million tweets in the first week alone. The dress was the subject of much discussion, with users using hashtags such as #thedress, #whiteandgold, and #blackandblue.
Major Bruce Middleton Hope Shand was a British Army officer who lived from January 22, 1917 to June 11, 2006.
Advertising is a form of marketing communication that uses audio or visual messages to promote products, services, or ideas. These messages are openly sponsored and non-personal.

The Others, a 2001 film, won eight Goya Awards, including Best Film and Best Director. It was the first English-language film to win Best Film at the Goyas, Spain's national film awards. The film was also nominated for six Saturn Awards, winning three: Best Horror Film, Best Actress for Nicole Kidman, and Best Supporting Actress for Fionnula Flanagan.
Ralph Fults was a Depression-era outlaw and escape artist who was associated with Raymond Hamilton, Bonnie Parker, and Clyde Barrow of the Barrow Gang.

The 14th Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, was born in 1935 in Taktser village, Tibet. He was recognized as the reincarnation of the 13th Dalai Lama in 1937 and formally declared the 14th Dalai Lama in 1939. During the 1959 Tibetan uprising, the Dalai Lama fled to India, where he remains a refugee.
